An Illinois man was arrested for an alleged attempt to firebomb the Chinese embassy in Washington.

He warned officers about a week earlier that he would attempt to firebomb the embassy. https://t.co/6kE5kFItMz
Doug Mastriano's come-from-nowhere popularity is fusing religion and politics in a new way. He's either Democrats' dream opponent, or the establishment's worst nightmare. https://t.co/ziDRQon8wl

The average U.S. gas price flirted with $5 a gallon on Friday, a record high.

But even as Americans complain about rising gas prices, they’re filling up their tanks at the fastest pace in three years. 
https://t.co/eD3J6J2tfK

The CDC is asking clinicians to watch for a widening range of monkeypox symptoms as U.S. cases rise and evidence of community spread mounts.

While monkeypox can be spread at close range, the CDC said it can't be transmitted over long distances by air.
https://t.co/rZBsZFrpSQ
Opinion: The new information from the Jan. 6 hearings reinforced what we already knew, making it unlikely that any minds will be changed https://t.co/pDB6LoDHuY

The White House said that the CDC still may bring back the requirement depending on rising Covid-19 cases 
https://t.co/ifNQXJP5R8
The United States has ordered 500,000 more monkeypox vaccine doses for delivery this year https://t.co/v4b73Lltig

The Washington Post has fired reporter Felicia Sonmez after she complained publicly about a perceived lack of institutional willingness to confront misogynistic treatment of female staffers.

A shooting at a Maryland business has claimed multiple victims. 

The suspect is no longer a threat to the community, according to law enforcement. 
https://t.co/BbTgLCCL7y

Biden says he’s looking at ways to shore up abortion rights if the Supreme Court overturns Roe v. Wade.

He has few options in states determined to restrict abortion – but there are actions his admin can take to bolster reproductive rights.
https://t.co/3U56Yu0XRV

NASA is launching a scientific study of reported UFO sightings to better understand the series of unidentified aircraft flying in protected airspace in recent years. 

The study isn’t related to a Pentagon Task force investigation of the phenomena. 
https://t.co/nChpWOCdAH
The Jan. 6 committee is opening its case to Americans with one overarching conclusion about the violence at the Capitol: It was carefully planned and orchestrated https://t.co/NBqTe0nQJf

https://t.co/MxA3FH8TIs

A former top aide to Mark Meadows has replaced her lawyer ahead of the Jan. 6 hearings.

Her previous attorney has deep Trump World connections, while her new lawyer is a longtime close ally of Jeff Sessions.
https://t.co/Lch9qt2FEZ

White House officials initially thought the situation was under control when a major infant formula plant shut down and issued a recall in February

It’s Mike Pence.

Trump World is still figuring out what to do about it.

Fourth grade Uvalde survivor Miah Cerrillo recounted horrific details of the school shooting in a video testimony before Congress.

"He shot my friend that was next to me, and I thought he was going to come back to the room, so I grabbed the blood and put it all over me." https://t.co/foneXyRSlW

California could become the first state to explicitly enshrine abortion rights in the state constitution.

The proposed amendment is up against a tight deadline and needs supermajority approval to make it on the November ballot. https://t.co/sYRlMyPB1H

The emotional testimonies before Congress come after a national outcry over the Buffalo and Uvalde mass shootings. Here’s how legislative efforts to pass a gun safety package in the House and Senate are going ⬇️

https://t.co/HztV3bYarb

A fourth grader recounted the Uvalde shooting to lawmakers in a gun violence hearing. 

She recalled smearing blood on herself to hide from the gunman and grabbing her dead teacher's phone to dial 911. 

"I don't want it to happen again," she said. https://t.co/M4KLJB0TND

A man was charged with attempted murder after he allegedly entered Brett Kavanaugh’s neighborhood with a gun.​

Authorities say the man had threatened to kill “a specific Supreme Court justice.”
https://t.co/0VL5PwZQyg

The Pentagon pledged to designate an agency to oversee the development of defenses against cruise missiles by the end of July after lawmakers threatened to cut the travel budget of its No. 2 official over the issue.

The bulk of the buy targets Democratic-held seats — a sign that there's a plethora of pickup opportunities for the GOP.

“People don’t want ... Donald Trump acolytes or supporters in office. That’s why people are being very clear-eyed about who they support."
https://t.co/ujrN6hDMIw

Dems acknowledge gun safety talks will fall far short of what they want.

"We start by making the loss of these lives matter."

POLITICO was denied access to the call by Rep. Elise Stefanik's office.

https://t.co/rTpNaFBxuT

Here's Sen. Amy Klobuchar speaking at the event: https://t.co/HEKgE0y0s1

It's primary day in California, which is once again poised to be the epicenter of the battle for the House.

The state has at least 10 potential swing districts, from the Sacramento suburbs to Orange County. @POLITICO_Steve runs through them all here👇 https://t.co/K0AgMiPokt

Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis is building momentum in the West. Over the weekend, he won a straw poll at "the largest gathering of conservatives in the Western U.S.," topping former President Trump.

https://t.co/ECyFHGokfY

In non-Cali news: Rep. Dusty Johnson (R-S.D.) is defending his seat from state Rep. Taffy Howard, who has spread Trump’s lies that the 2020 election was stolen. Johnson had voted to create a bipartisan commission to investigate the Jan. 6 attack.

https://t.co/54EKIkP02F

What else? Keep your eyes on LA’s mayoral race, where billionaire (and former Republican) Rick Caruso is neck-and-neck with progressive Democratic Rep. Karen Bass.

https://t.co/AjXRk1SOUr

Two CA House Republicans — Reps. David Valadao and Young Kim — in particular could be in trouble. They face uncomfortably close primary contests — and a loss by either could seriously endanger the GOP’s hold on their swing seats in the fall.

https://t.co/DRPUdAX6cs

Everyone’s watching CA’s all-party primaries, and with good reason: the path to the House majority crosses through the Golden state (again). 

https://t.co/I0Bx0QlA4O

https://t.co/evYhamaBQw

National Democrats are making a last-minute foray into a special House election next week in South Texas, spending six-figures to keep Republicans from flipping a seat that’s been blue for decades

https://t.co/6UeH8VB9sU

Concern about rising crime is overtaking key elections in California Tuesday, where liberal voters are putting pressure on Democrats around the state to address a growing sense of lawlessness spurred during the pandemic

https://t.co/evYhamaBQw

The Indivisible Project, a network of local progressive organizing groups that sprang up during the Trump administration, is spending $7 million in the 2022 midterms to help elect Democrats by emphasizing “MAGA extremism.”

https://t.co/UKDRjBuGd5

Progressives two years ago won a big battle by getting the Federal Reserve to ease up on inflation. Now, the staying power of that hard-fought victory is in doubt.

https://t.co/wZorhvIsfL

Eric Garcetti allies privately pressured Sen. Mark Kelly to support the LA mayor's ambassadorial nomination, according to sources.

The White House reiterated that Garcetti played no part in the pressure campaign.

https://t.co/NTVtpmSNmb

A U.S. gov report to be released Tuesday backs Afghan President Ashraf Ghani's claims that he and his coterie didn't flee with millions following the Taliban's takeover of Afghanistan.

“[It] may have been closer in value to $500,000,” the report states.

https://t.co/s4ewQkNrBs

The Justice Department has charged leaders of the Proud Boys — the pro-Trump extremist group that played a central role in the Jan. 6, 2021 Capitol attack — with conspiring to use force to oppose the presidential transfer of power.

https://t.co/GRiU4zg4Hz

House Democrats spent former President Trump’s final years in office passing bills that withered in the Senate but shaped the party’s presidential-campaign agenda — and as 2024 approaches, their GOP colleagues are poised to follow the same model.

https://t.co/yplHRbvdaK

The office of Rep. Marjorie Taylor Greene confirmed to POLITICO that far-right provocateur Milo Yiannopoulos is now an intern there. The Daily Beast was first to report the hire.

https://t.co/zT3bfxkT7B

As President Joe Biden prepares to host the Summit of the Americas, expectations are low that he'll deliver. He has no serious trade deals to offer and migration remains unresolved.

Here’s what to watch for during the gathering ⬇️

New York signed stronger gun-control measure into law today. 

The new laws will bolster existing ones and close what state leaders viewed as loopholes, including those that allowed the Buffalo shooter to slip through the state's Red Flag statute.

https://t.co/BJCEwwFRY0

Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador says he'll skip the Summit of the Americas this week after the U.S. didn't invite authoritarian leaders from Cuba, Nicaragua and Venezuela.

“There cannot be a summit if all countries are not invited,” he said. https://t.co/YnfRv4sa1N

A college campus free-speech group is broadening its efforts to fight so-called cancel culture and other perceived threats to free speech in America.

Some see the push as a challenge the ACLU's primacy as a defender of free speech. https://t.co/jCz4y7qBDQ
Communication around the pandemic and its eventual end have long presented a challenge for the White House https://t.co/9lCvu9Khel
The campaign has fueled a lobbying bonanza on the part of digital asset startups, venture capitalists and consumer watchdogs https://t.co/F54Bb73h96

President Joe Biden and his aides have grown increasingly frustrated by their inability to turn the tide against a cascade of challenges threatening to overwhelm the administration https://t.co/oTzYMUF5uo
